title: Swagger endpoint to get graphId
body: Currently there is a `/graph/config/description` endpoint to get the graph description, but not one for graphId. Would be useful if an endpoint existed for graphId, for cases like https://github.com/gchq/gaffer-experimental/issues/70.

title: Allow NamedOperations to reference each other
body:
At present, you cannot call one NamedOperation from inside another.  This presents a barrier to the re-use of operation chains, requires moderately complex operation chains to be longer and less readable, makes it difficult to propagate changes to commonly used code through a community, and all the other drawbacks that come with a lack of composability.

This restriction is intentional, as it allows us to avoid dealing with thorny issues such as version control of NamedOperations, the impact of propagating changes to an included operation onto the operations which include it, what happens if a user has permissions to only a subset of NamedOperations which comprise a single nested NamedOperation and so on.

However, given the benefits that could be delivered by allowing the nesting of NamedOperations, is it time to revisit this decision?

title: Renamed CreateSplitPointsIT to Test
body: This is to allow us to automate the accumulo integration tests. As things stand the CreateSplitPointsIT doesn't use the store.class in the storeProperties which becomes problematic when running in docker on K8s (connections fail when setting up a MiniAccumuloStore). Therefore I've renamed it to CreateSplitPointsTest so that it's run in the test phase rather than the integration test one.

title: NamedOperations and Operation Chains do not accept multiple inputs
body:
The GetElementsBetweenSets operation requires both an input and input_b.

However, if this operation is nested within an operation chain and defined as a named operation there is no way to pass in input_b. 

This addition would be required for future inclusions of operations such as: GetShortestPaths, GetWalksBetween etc. that would require multiple inputs.

The option to provide an input map with multiple input sets/collections might cover this.

Possibly something that would need to wait for v2.

title: gh-2391 Add classifier

body: To release the original jar as well as the executable one, a classifier should be added to the spring boot plugin when generating the executable jar.

title: Proxy Store should be able to send operations to the spring-rest
body: The proxy store struggles to send messages to the spring-rest api. This is because of the default headers that are sent with the request.

title: Spring rest api doesn't return helpful error messages when JSON is invalid
body: When invalid json is provided, the Spring boot REST API just returns 400 without explanation. It should return the error much like the core-rest api does.

title: Proxy Store should be able to target non /v2 endpoints
body: The proxy store is designed to work against the core-rest project which statically sets the v2 rest api on /v2 or /latest. The spring-rest api though allows you to dynamically set the context path. The ProxyStore should be able to target these. For backwards compatibility, the default should still be /rest/v2 but should not force the context root to end with v2 as it does now.

title: Allow spring-rest to be used by multiple stores with standard libraries
body:
Trying to bundle in store dependencies manually can be challenging because of the custom exclude / include rules that exist on each of the stores. If the stores were just included by default, it would save time and complexity. 

We may encounter issues in future with this though as there may be clashing dependencies between the stores. For now though, it seems possible to include all the stores without issue.

title: Spring rest only returns results if Accept: application/json is set
body: Spring Rest only returns results if the header Accept: application/json header is set. If using Accept */* for example, it fails with an Unacceptable error

title: Is anyone using the Hbase Store?
body: We are looking to do a number of version upgrades in Gaffer 2.0 including moving to Hadoop 3. HBase does not support Hadoop 3 out the box (it needs to be built from source using a profile). If someone is using the Hbase Store, we can take steps to include it in version 2. However, if no one is using it, we would benefit from removing support for the Hbase store until HBase releases a compatible version

title: gh-2335 Adding github workflow to automate koryphe version update.
bugfix for gh-2239:  Merging views with global elements
body:
Resolves #2293 

Only expand Global* elements in a View if the schema contains an entry with that element type in.  This supports stores such as the FederatedStore where the first Store a query gets run against is in some way a proxy of some other store(s) and doesn't have the schema information to do the expansion.

Also, update the logic in updateOperationChain such that it no longer expands  a View with no entities and edges but, e.g., a globalEntities element to include all of the edges.

When reviewing, please note that I've chosen to change updateOperationChain to default scope for testing purposes and because the code didn't feel like it was perfectly encapsulated by the logic of executing a query.  Alternatively, I could change the tests to run against the public execute method (which felt a bit broad) or use reflection to test the method as a private (but I'm not sure how you feel about that 'round these parts).  Lastly, where there's identical logic for Edges and Entities, I've only included a unit for the edges part, but let me know if you want a repeated unit test for the Entities logic

title: Gh 2334 automate releases

I've added a workflow which operates pretty much as the old [deploy.sh](https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/gaffer2-1.13.4/cd/deploy.sh) script used to. The only difference being that it is triggered by the closing of a milestone, rather than a push to master and the jobs run in parallel.

I've tested the workflow in [another repo](https://github.com/d47853/actions-test).

# Related Issue

Automatically update Koryphe version on new koryphe release
body:
Add an action which updates the koryphe version upon a new Koryphe release. It can use the ./cd/updateKorypheVersion.sh script if necessary.

This will save developer time.

title: Automate releases
body:
Releasing Gaffer is a manual process of one of the Gaffer admins changing the RELEASE_VERSION variable on travis, merging develop -> master and then closing a milestone. The actual release is taken care of by Travis CI using the deploy.sh script.

It would be better to automate this process with Github actions. We could use the milestone closure as the trigger and use the version in that milestone to do the release.

It could either use the existing deploy.sh script with some tweaking or be split into different jobs. The latter might make for a more transparent release process and better release notes as there are already a few nice example actions we can make use of.

title: Automatically link issues with pull requests
body: When a pull request is opened, it should be automatically be linked with the issues it resolves to save us the job of manually closing the issue when merged. You could do this with Github actions.

title: Gh 2331 Switched from Travis to Github actions for CI
body:
I've investigated the possibility of switching to Github pages for our CI. I found that the number of concurrent jobs that can be run is significantly higher and the initial queue time is negligible.
Plus it tends to give us a more open view of how the build is progressing.
I've not yet included the release side of our CI in this pull request. I think it would be beneficial but outside the scope of this issue.

title: Should we move away from Travis CI?
body:
This week the average queue time for a job is ~30-45 minutes. For pull requests, this is significantly increasing build and release times.

Should we consider a different provider such as Github Actions to pursue faster build times?

title: Evaluating default AccessPredicates can cause roles to change order
body: When a DefaultUserPredicate is created, it calls Collections.sort() on the incoming auths. This is done to disregard ordering during an equals() comparison. However as a consequence, the auths on a NamedOperationDetail or other resource can be accidentally changed.

title: Changing default store type broke gaffer-tools
body: Changing the default store type in road-traffic-rest as part of #2322 has broken the UI project in gaffer tools. More investigation is probably needed into why the UI project fails to build using the Map Store. This is probably due, at least in some part to the MapStore not implementing query time aggregation, thereby causing failing system tests.

title: FederatedStore-FederatedAccess: Inappropriate usage of GraphAuths arguments
body:
FederatedStore-FederatedAccess: Inappropriate usage of GraphAuths Arguments

During a AddGraph Operation a User can set `graphAuths` and `readAccessPredicates`. 
The following code appears to junk the `graphAuths` if `readAccessPredicate` was set. 

```this.readAccessPredicate = new String(JSONSerialiser.serialise(readAccessPredicate != null ? readAccessPredicate : new FederatedGraphReadAccessPredicate(addingUserId, graphAuths, isPublic)));```

This will be confusing usage for setting authorisations. It is likely that the `graphAuths` should be merged into the `readAccessPredicate`.

This requires deserialisation on every usage of FederatedAccess on graphs, This seems wasteful.

title: Fix failing release build
body:
Our releases are failing in Travis after being deployed. This is causing our releases not to be updated on Github and our javadoc not to be updated.

Here is a copy of the error:
```
--------------------------------------
Updating javadoc
--------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project hdfs-library: Could not resolve dependencies for project uk.gov.gchq.gaffer:hdfs-library:jar:1.13.1: Could not find artifact uk.gov.gchq.gaffer:sketches-library:jar:deploy:1.13.1 in google-maven-central (https://maven-central.storage-download.googleapis.com/maven2/) -> [Help 1]
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/DependencyResolutionException
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] After correcting the problems, you can resume the build with the command
[ERROR]   mvn <goals> -rf :hdfs-library
The command "./cd/deploy.sh" exited with 1.
```

The code responsible for this is: `mvn -q clean install -Pquick -Dskip.jar-with-dependencies=true -Dshaded.jar.phase=true`

This line seems to fail because there is a deploy classifier one of the hdfs-library's test dependencies.

Gh 2306 fix serialisation issue
AccessPredicate causes NamedViews/NamedOperations to fail serialisation
body:
Because AccessPredicate implementations don't implement Serializable there is an issue when using disk caches that rely on that mechanism. To fix this, JsonSerialise the predicates and store the strings (like we do for operation chains in the NamedOperationDetail).

To replicate, run the REST API and add a named view. It will succeed (with the below stack trace in the logs) but when the REST API reloads the NamedView will be lost as it wasn't written to disk.


title: Create a spring boot app
body: At the moment we bundle up everything into a WAR and deploy to a container of our choosing: Wildfly, Tomcat etc. This has a major drawback in that we have to create a new WAR each time we want to add new dependencies (one for Accumulo REST, one for Federated REST etc). It also has a knock on effect for extending our [Docker images](https://github.com/gchq/gaffer-docker). To make the REST API more extendable, we want to create an app using the Spring boot framework which will be carried forward into Gaffer version 2.0.

title: gh-2295 Harmonise resource access controls for Named Operations Named Views and Federated Store Graphs.
Upgrade to Java 11
body:
Upgrading Gaffer to Java 11 will allow us to keep up with the Java LTS version and leverage some of the new features in post-Java 8 versions such as better integration with container technologies, the JShell and new language features.

The scope of this change is to make Gaffer able to be built as a Java 11 project. A further ticket will be added for modularisation.

title: Harmonise access mechanisms for Gaffer resources
body:
For resources such as NamedOperations and Graphs in the Federated Store, it would be really neat to harmonise and improve the way that access control is implemented. It would need to be flexible so that it can be applied to different resources. Therefore it would make sense to have a predicate that is applied to a user accessing a given resource which can be configured by more advanced users. 

For this to be accepted in Gaffer 1.x, it would need to be backwards compatible with what's already there.

The resources I'd expect this to work for are:
* NamedOperations
* NamedViews
* Graphs (Federated Store)

Doing this would make what's access control more flexible and easier to implement for any new resources.

title: Response to the gh-1836-demo example.
body:
I have looked at the demo and taken that and other comments and reorganised the approach to the Mock to Mini Accumulo changes.
This pull request branch has only a few changes outlining how I will go about progressing gh-1836.

It was noted for the gh-1836-demo that as the Mini Accumulo Cluster should behave exactly as full Accumulo we shouldn't need any MiniAccumuloStore sub classes. This does indeed work but given the normal mechanism used by Gaffer to identify a store type is the class name specified in the properties files. This means the MiniAccumuloStore and SingleUseMiniAccumuloStore classes are needed for identification purposes, unless I have misunderstood something in this area.
The new MiniAccumuloStore class extends AccumuloStore with no changes to functionality.
The new SingleUseMiniAccumuloStore extends MiniAccumuloStore in exactly the same manner as SingleUseAccumuloStore extends AccumuloStore.
They are extended in this way rather than SingleUseMiniAccumuloStore extending SingleUseAccumuloStore to replicate the AccumuloStore object hierarchy.

Control of the decision whether to start a MiniAccumuloCluster, and the starting and stopping it, is handled by the new AccumuloTestClusterManager class. This takes an AccumuloProperties object in its constructor and reads it to find the store class. If it is a Mini Accumulo one it sets up and starts a MiniAccumuloCluster and updates the properties with the zookeeper details. If not it just returns.
Creation of the object is called at the beginning of a test suite, often through the @BeforeClass annotated method.
At the end of a test suite (@AfterClass) the close method is called to close and tidy away the Mini Accumulo Cluster if one has been started. The test suite will have kept the reference to the AccumuloTestClusterManager object for this purpose.

There are three tests converted from using Mock to Mini:
AccumuloStoreITs from the demo is suitably modified to use the new AccumuloTestClusterManager. This is slightly odd looking as for this test the constructors receive the properties. This prevents use of the @BeforeClass as that has to be a static method so cannot use instance attributes.
GetDataFrameOfElementsHandlerTest is a spark-accumulo test that was constructed to set up its store only from properties. This was among the tests that previously had a lot of duplicated code. They will now have an abstract superclass, AbstractPropertiesDrivenTest, to handle most of the repeating setup.
AccumuloStoreTest is an example of the most common types of unit tests. This had explicit Mock handling as part of the tests, in some cases with SingleUseMockAccumuloStore being instantiated by individual tests. This has been converted to reuse of a pair of mini accumulo clusters for all the tests.

In all the test examples above I have avoided declaration of the MiniAccumuloStore and SingleUseMiniAccumuloStore classes as far as possible, instead having any necessary Store declarations being for AccumuloStore.

Is this closer to what was expected?

title: road traffic example start.sh needs a "finished" message
body:
Following the instructions for running the Road Traffic Example, I run the start.sh as described in the Gaffer doc. Hundreds of lines of messages pour up the screen at varying speeds as different artefacts are downloaded, built etc. Eventually it hangs there on:

INFO: Starting ProtocolHandler ["http-bio-8080"]

I sit there a bit longer expecting that it will start running again. Eventually I wonder maybe it has finished and try opening the browser. Oh! yes the script has finished, probably some minutes ago. I could have been doing something useful.  

IWBNI if a user-friendly message tells you when the script has completed.

title: Gh 2278 mapreduce support for json serialiser modules
AddElementsFromHdfs operation should support JSONSerialiserModules
body:
The `AddElementsFromHdfs` operation does not respect the JSONSerialiserModules configured in the corresponding `store.properties` file. For example, attempting to load the Road Traffic data serialised as JSON using something like:
```
{
	"class": "uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.hdfs.operation.AddElementsFromHdfs",
	"failurePath": "/tmp/failure",
	"workingPath": "/tmp/working",
	"inputMapperPairs": {
		"/data": "uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.hdfs.operation.mapper.generator.JsonMapperGenerator"
	},
	"jobInitialiser": {
		"class": "uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.hdfs.operation.handler.job.initialiser.TextJobInitialiser"
	},
	"outputPath": "/output",
	"splitsFilePath": "/tmp/splits/splitsFile"
}
```
with a `store.properties` file containing:
```
gaffer.serialiser.json.modules=uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.sketches.serialisation.json.SketchesJsonModules
```
will result in the exception:
```
Error: uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.core.exception.GafferRuntimeException: Unable to process JSON string: {"class":"uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.element.Entity","group":"Cardinality","vertex":"South West","properties":{"hllp":{"com.clearspring.analytics.stream.cardinality.HyperLogLogPlus":{"bytes":"/////gUFAQH3FQ=="}},"count":{"java.lang.Long":1},"edgeGroup":{"java.util.TreeSet":["RegionContainsLocation"]}}}. Message: No suitable constructor found for type [simple type, class com.clearspring.analytics.stream.cardinality.HyperLogLogPlus]: can not instantiate from JSON object (missing default constructor or creator, or perhaps need to add/enable type information?)
 at [Source: {"class":"uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.element.Entity","group":"Cardinality","vertex":"South West","properties":{"hllp":{"com.clearspring.analytics.stream.cardinality.HyperLogLogPlus":{"bytes":"/////gUFAQH3FQ=="}},"count":{"java.lang.Long":1},"edgeGroup":{"java.util.TreeSet":["RegionContainsLocation"]}}}; line: 1, column: 181] (through reference chain: uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.element.Entity["properties"]->uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.element.Properties["hllp"])
```

title: Create Command line utility to run an operation
body:
Create a command line utility which creates a graph from a store properties file and graph config, and runs an operation as a provided user. You could use json serialisation for the operation and user.

This will allow for admins to run operations which they would otherwise be unable to run without custom jars such as AddElementsFromHdfs.

gh-2262 Schema.fromJson should support traversing nested directories …
body: …when processing a path.

title: Schema.fromJson() does not support schema directories containing subdirectories
body:
I've been trying to run the [RoadTrafficDataLoader](https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/master/example/road-traffic/road-traffic-generators/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/traffic/generator/RoadTrafficDataLoader.java), loading the schema from a directory which contains subdirectories. This results in an exception:
```
Exception in thread "main" uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.elementdefinition.exception.SchemaException: Failed to load element definitions from bytes
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.elementdefinition.ElementDefinitions$BaseBuilder.json(ElementDefinitions.java:323)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.elementdefinition.ElementDefinitions$BaseBuilder.json(ElementDefinitions.java:285)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.schema.Schema$BaseBuilder.json(Schema.java:531)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.schema.Schema.fromJson(Schema.java:116)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.traffic.generator.RoadTrafficDataLoader.main(RoadTrafficDataLoader.java:106)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Is a directory
	at sun.nio.ch.FileDispatcherImpl.read0(Native Method)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileDispatcherImpl.read(FileDispatcherImpl.java:46)
	at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.readIntoNativeBuffer(IOUtil.java:223)
	at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.read(IOUtil.java:197)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.read(FileChannelImpl.java:159)
	at sun.nio.ch.ChannelInputStream.read(ChannelInputStream.java:65)
	at sun.nio.ch.ChannelInputStream.read(ChannelInputStream.java:109)
	at sun.nio.ch.ChannelInputStream.read(ChannelInputStream.java:103)
	at java.nio.file.Files.read(Files.java:3105)
	at java.nio.file.Files.readAllBytes(Files.java:3158)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.elementdefinition.ElementDefinitions$BaseBuilder.json(ElementDefinitions.java:314)
	... 4 more
```

Interestingly the REST API doesn't throw such an exception when pointing it at the same directory. Took a look and found that this is because the REST API loads the schema by [calling Graph.Builder().addSchema(Path)](https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/48579e1e3ff18bfa846a053c2e5603819f9753e4/rest-api/core-rest/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/rest/factory/DefaultGraphFactory.java#L117). This method contains code to recursively walk directories:
https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/48579e1e3ff18bfa846a053c2e5603819f9753e4/core/graph/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/graph/Graph.java#L842-L851

Compare this to Schema.fromJson(Path), which [RoadTrafficDataLoader](https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/48579e1e3ff18bfa846a053c2e5603819f9753e4/example/road-traffic/road-traffic-generators/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/traffic/generator/RoadTrafficDataLoader.java#L106) uses. This doesn't include a recursive call for directories:
https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/48579e1e3ff18bfa846a053c2e5603819f9753e4/core/data/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/data/elementdefinition/ElementDefinitions.java#L304-L315

title: Gh 2249 accumulo upgrade to 1.9.3
body:
Hi - I've made the changes for Accumulo 1.9.3:

- I've added new tests for the `rfilereaderrdd` package in JUnit5 to help increase the coverage and to manage any changes in behaviour after upgrading
- Also refactored some of the existing tests and upgraded to JUnit5 to use some of the newer features
- I fixed the compiler errors RFileReaderIterator caused by updating the Accumulo version to 1.9.3
- I ran the integration tests locally against a MiniAccumulo cluster I ran locally and all passed
- I also updated the README how to set up integration tests on a local cluster to help future developers/users

I can add more tests and increase the coverage in the modules that consume the Accumulo dependency? - I wasn't sure how far to go with it so thought I'd raise the pull request anyway and see what you think - I'm don't mind writing more.

Also let me know of any other recommendations/changes you require for this or if you run any additional Accumulo tests of your own that picks something? 

Cheers

title: CVEs in the dependencies are in the execution path of your project
body:
Hello,
I found that your project uses some dependencies with CVEs and the buggy methods of the CVEs are in the program execution path of your project, which makes your project at risk. I have suggested some version updates. Here is the detailed information:

* **Vulnerable Dependency:** org.apache.hadoop : hadoop-common : 2.6.5

* **Call Chain to Buggy Methods:**

  * **Some files in your project call the library method org.apache.hadoop.io.SequenceFile.Reader.next(org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable), which can reach the buggy method of [CVE-2017-15713](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15713).**

  * Files in your project: 
    library/hdfs-library/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/hdfs/operation/handler/job/tool/SampleDataAndCreateSplitsFileTool.java

    * One of the possible call chain:

    ```
    org.apache.hadoop.io.SequenceFile.Reader.next(org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable) [buggy method]
    ```

  * **Some files in your project call the library method org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool,java.lang.String[]), which can reach the buggy method of [CVE-2017-15713](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15713).**

    * Files in your project: 
      store-implementation/hbase-store/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/hbasestore/operation/hdfs/handler/AddElementsFromHdfsHandler.java
    * One of the possible call chain:

    ```
    org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool,java.lang.String[])
    org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration,org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool,java.lang.String[])
    org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.<init>(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration,java.lang.String[])
    org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.<init>(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration,org.apache.commons.cli.Options,java.lang.String[])
    org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.parseGeneralOptions(org.apache.commons.cli.Options,org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration,java.lang.String[])
    org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.processGeneralOptions(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration,org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine)
    org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.getLibJars(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration)
    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.get(java.lang.String)
    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.substituteVars(java.lang.String) [buggy method]
    ```

* **Update suggestion:** version 3.2.1
  3.2.1 is a safe version without CVEs. From 2.6.5 to 3.2.1, 6 of the APIs (called by 10 times in your project) were modified.

title: Upgrade Accumulo version to 1.9.3
body:
An upgrade of Apache Accumulo is required from the current version (1.8.X) to 1.9.3. This would allow us to take advantage of some of the containerisation features found in 1.9.X without having to make the breaking changes required when upgrading to Accumulo 2.X.X.

Backwards compatibility should be ensured such that anyone still using older versions of Accumulo can still use the new version of Gaffer without having to upgrade their Accumulo installation. 

Info about 1.9.3 here: https://accumulo.apache.org/release/accumulo-1.9.3/

A precursor to #2201 
Related to #2200

Build fails if koryphe release has not reached maven central
body:
During a release cycle, there is latency between releasing the artefacts from OSS Sonatype to them being published to maven central. This latency has increased with the decommissioning of insecure maven central. 

As Koryphe and Gaffer tend to be released at the same time, it would be useful if koryphe could be built from source if it fails to be retrieved from maven central.

title: Expand the library of functions for Gaffer types
body:
Functions such as:
- TypeSubTypeValueToTuple (converts TypeSubTypeValue into a String Tuple with 'type', 'subType', 'value' as keys. A test for this would be to convert a TypeSubTypeValue into a Tuple, then extract the Value and call Length then ToString. Then extract the Type and call SetValue('Length')
- TypeValueToTuple (same as above but for TypeValue objects)
- ToTrailingWildcardPair (produces a Pair of EntityIds to allow a follow on query using the GetElementsInRanges operation. Implements KorypheFunction<Object, Pair<EntityId, EntityId>>. Allows the user to provide the end of the range (defaults to `~`). For example, takes the String 'value1' and the end of the range `'~'` and produces `new Pair(new EntitySeed('value1'), new EntitySeed('value1~'))`. 
- ReduceRelatedElements (takes an iterable of elements and reduces elements that have related vertices. For example A1-relates-to->A2,  B1-relates-to->B2.  A1->B1 and A2->B2 should be merged into 1 edge A1->B1 with properties on the edge relatedSourceVertices: ['A2'] and relatedDestinationVertices: ['B2'].

title: Automatically add Delegate store operations to federated store
body:
The federated store will likely have delegate stores underneath it. For example it may federate across graphs built on Accumulo, Hbase etc. These delegate stores will, by default, support operations which aren't supported by the Federated Store by default. For example, the AccumuloStore supports the GetElementsInRanges operation. 

It would be good for the FederatedStore to support all operations supported by delegate stores and use the operation forwarding handler.

title: changes
JSONSerialiser unable handle some primitive data types and throws Unrecognized token error.
body:
JSONSerialisation is unable to serialise some primitive types and causes errors.

This can occurring between proxied stores. A store may return a Long value and the receiving store is unable to deserialise correctly.

To replicate the bug.
Examine `IfIT.java` and tests `ShouldReturnOriginalInputWhenConditionIsFalseAndNoOtherwise` and `ShouldReturnOriginalInputWhenConditionIsTrueAndNoThen`. examine lines containing `//This test input has been changed to an integer to avoid triggering a bug JSONSerialisation.`

Change for both test:
`ifOperation.setInput(404);` to `ifOperation.setInput(INPUT_CAMEL_CASE);`
`new IsA("java.lang.String")));` to `new IsA("java.lang.Integer")));`
`assertEquals(404, output);` to `assertEquals(INPUT_CAMEL_CASE, output);`
` assertTrue(output instanceof Integer);` to  `assertTrue(output instanceof String);`

and error will occur when you run the `ProxyStoreITs` (make it easier on yourself add `singleTest(IfIT.class);` to this class temporarily do no push this change.)

This errors with `OperationException: Unrecognized token 'AbCd': was expecting ('true', 'false' or 'null')`

...fix!

IF operations always executes otherwise logic
Upgrade Accumulo version to 2.x.x
body:
Upgrade version of Accumulo so that we can use the Accumulo Docker container as the baseline for Gaffer containerisation.

There is an accumulo-docker project that works for Accumulo 2.0.0+ which is supported apache accumulo but is not released to Dockerhub
There is a branch of accumulo-docker which supports accumulo 1.9.3+

Upgrading to 1.9.3 is fairly simple but 2.0.0 would need more work as MockAccumulo  is removed in this version. We would need to replace all the MockAccumuloStores from Gaffer should we choose to change this. As this would be a breaking change, it would have to be done in Gaffer 2.x.x

Helpful information available here: https://accumulo.apache.org/docs/2.x/administration/upgrading#upgrading-from-189-to-20

Linked to #2200

title: Containerise Gaffer
body:
If Gaffer was put into a docker container, it would make it easier to deploy across a wide range of platforms.

The docker container should have a distributed accumulo store and rest service. It should be configured like any Gaffer graph
Further stores could be added in the future.

There are a few hurdles to get over before we can get to this stage chief among which will be an Accumulo upgrade (an official accumulo Docker container was added in Accumulo 2.0 but is not released to dockerhub).

gh-2190 Fixed Timeunit bug
TimestampSet Predicate test is failing
body:
There is a failing test on develop at:
```
java.lang.AssertionError
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.time.predicate.RBMBackedTimestampSetInRangeTest.shouldReturnTrueIfAllTimestampsAreWithinRange(RBMBackedTimestampSetInRangeTest.java:72)
```

This can be fixed temporarily by adding the timeUnit to the predicate. There is an underlying issue in the RBMBackedTimestampSet where it converts longs to ints. 

Times in the predicate have to be converted to the time unit in the TimestampSet. At the same time they are converted to Integer values. When converted, times that fall outside the upper limit of Integers can be converted to a negative number. This causes unusual results in the RBMBackedTimestampInRange predicate, as well as the MaskTimestampSetByTimeRange function.

body:
GetDataFrameOfElements can't get the attribute column value with java.util.Date/java.sql.Timestamp to DF column

This is my related configuration：

schema = ...edge("EDGE", new SchemaEdgeDefinition.Builder()
                        .source("Person")
                        .destination("Person")
                        .directed("true")
                        .property("date", "dateTypeName")
                        .property("je", "jeTypeName")
                        .aggregate(false)
                        .build())
                    .type("EDGE", new TypeDefinition.Builder()
                            .clazz(String.class)
                            .build())
                    .type("dateTypeName", new TypeDefinition.Builder()
                            **.clazz(Timestamp.class) // java.util.Date.calss**
                            .build())

Load Data:

                        .group(EDGE)
                        .source(cxkh)
                        .dest(dscxkh)
                        .directed(true)
                        **.property("date", date)**
                        .property("je", je)

GetDataFrameOfElements dfOperation = new GetDataFrameOfElements.Builder()
                .view(new View.Builder().edge("EDGE").build()).build();
        Dataset<Row> dataFrame = graph.execute(dfOperation, user);
        dataFrame.show();

**result:**
+------+---+---+--------+-------------+-------------+

|EDGE|116|117|    true|         null|9000.0|

title: Allow use of namespace for accumulo store
body:
Currently if you try using namespaces with Gaffer on Accumulo by setting the graph id to namespace.tablename it to fails because the '.' is an invalid character.

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Id is invalid: mynamespace.MyTableId, it must match regex: [a-zA-Z0-9_]*
 at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.library.GraphLibrary.validateId(GraphLibrary.java:282)
 at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.library.GraphLibrary.get(GraphLibrary.java:123)
 at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.library.GraphLibrary.checkExisting(GraphLibrary.java:291) 
 at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.library.GraphLibrary.checkExisting(GraphLibrary.java:287)
 at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.graph.Graph$Builder.build(Graph.java:866)
 at ...
```

I'm raising this issue to follow on from the discussion on chat, the outcomes of which are:
* The allowed characters for the graphId were limited because of an issue with using '.' for the Parquet store
* Namespaces in accumulo lets you grant namespace level permissions to a user (https://static.javadoc.io/org.apache.accumulo/accumulo-core/1.8.0/org/apache/accumulo/core/security/NamespacePermission.html). That means you could create a namespace and grant your write user permission to create tables only in that namespace rather than having to grant them system level permission instead (ie System.CREATE_TABLE) 
* The namespace option should be added to accumulo store properties

title: Right inner joins not working with KeyFunctionMatch
body:
When using the KeyFunctionMatch, you get incorrect results for Right Inner Joins.

Given a left hand side of
Entity 1 with property "a",
Entity 2 with property "a",
Entity 3 with property "a"

A right hand side of "a"

And using an Identity function for the right and ExtractProperty function for the left, you get results which look like:

Entity 3 with property "a" and "a"
Entity 3 with property "a" and "a"
Entity 3 with property "a" and "a"

You can see from the results that only the last match is being returned.

title: SchemaElementDefinition is not thread-safe
body:
`SchemaElementDefinition` is not thread-safe. The method `getIngestAggregator` can cause this exception if it is called by two methods at the same time:

    Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: null
	at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableCollection.add(Collections.java:1055)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.schema.SchemaElementDefinition.addTypeAggregateFunction(SchemaElementDefinition.java:463)
	at uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.schema.SchemaElementDefinition.getIngestAggregator(SchemaElementDefinition.java:238)

This seems to the reason the CI tests for the Parquet store fail randomly (see https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/pull/2147).

The methods `getFullAggregator` and `getQueryAggregator` have the same problem.

This is marked as a bug because the Javadoc does not say that these methods are not thread-safe.

Possible solutions:

- Mark these methods as `synchronized`. This is a simple fix (it solved the problem with the occasional failures in the CI for the Parquet store). This may reduce the performance of this method. We could look for all uses of these methods and ensure that the caller caches the result for re-use.
- Add a comment to the Javadoc for `SchemaElementDefinition` to say that they are not thread-safe, and change the code in the Parquet store that uses them to avoid the synchronisation problem. Downside - in future code we may get errors due to them not being thread-safe.
- Calculate the ingest and full aggregators when the `SchemaElementDefinition` class is created and then just return them. This isn't possible for the query aggregator though as that depends on parameters passed into the method.

ParquetStore tests aren't descriptive and contain incorrect logic
body:
Some test methods in AbstractOperationsTest class, such as "getElementsWithPostAggregationFilterTest" and "getElementsWithPostTransformFilterTest" have fairly misleading names, and the test logic is not clear, concise, nor does it often directly relate to the test name.

For example, the "getElementsWithPostAggregationFilterTest" could be named "shouldThrowUnsupportedTraitExceptionWithPostAggregationFiltering", which is more descriptive, and specific to the test logic.  This should then assert that the Exception thrown is actually relevant/as expected.  Currently the only assertion is that a StoreException is thrown, containing the phrase "Operation chain".  This will still pass even if other aspects, such as the view are incorrect/invalid.

title: Join operation does not allow merging of different groups
body:
Currently, the Join operation (with an Element Matcher and Merger) behaves like a schema aggregator. It merges two elements of the same group using the schema and given group by properties. However a typical SQL Join would be able to join rows of different tables.

The best way to change this would be to change how the matcher works, and make the Merger optional. The matcher should take two functions to apply to each of the iterables on the left and output of the right, then compare the results to determine what is a match.

If the matcher returned a Map Tuple containing the key, the left side matches and right side matches, then we could perform a Map operation afterwards to select the relevant properties/elements and manipulate the output.

This could replace the Merger to reduce complexity of the Join operation.

Furthermore, to avoid a performance hit, any Joins which require iterating over both the left and right hand side (Full and Full Outer) will be removed.

title: GetVariable and SetVariable operations don't work properly with FederatedStore
body:
The GetVariable and SetVariable operations don't work properly with FederatedStore. This is due to the federated store performing a shallow clone on the user context before sending it to each of the federated graphs. The logic to do the shallow clone does not copy the variables across to the clone.

This is the logic that needs to be updated: https://github.com/gchq/Gaffer/blob/master/core/store/src/main/java/uk/gov/gchq/gaffer/store/Context.java#L62

As a workaround you could execute your operation wrapped inside a FederatedOperationChain.

However if the user specifies a view in their query, they receive an error telling them their view was invalid. This is confusing and obscures the true source of the error.

title: Updating koryphe version 1.6.0-RC4
NamedOperation parameter substitution allows execution of unauthorised Operations
body:
See comment on #2090 - Whilst that issue fixes the addition of new named operations, there is a related issue where it is possible to substitute an operation using named operation parameters when executed the NamedOperation. Any operation that is substituted in this way is not subject to the authorisations check.

This could be resolved by having NamedOperation also implement the Operations interface (similar to the fix for #2090), and have the getOperations() method return any parameters that are instances of Operation. This way, the auth checking would be applied to any operations supplied by a user as a parameter.

title: Operations within AddNamedOperation are not validated by OperationAuthoriser
body:
AddNamedOperation does not implement Operations, so the OperationAuthoriser does not inspect the nested Operations. This allows someone to add an Operation they wouldn't normally be able to run into a NamedOperation and then run it via the NamedOperation.

This only becomes an issue if you choose to define the graph hooks in the order:
- OperationAuthoriser
- NamedOperationResolver

By default the NamedOperationResolver is added first like:
- NamedOperationResolver
- OperationAuthoriser
In this case the the operations within a NamedOperation are all validated correctly.

title: Configurable Store with default Handlers
body:
supersedes gh-2028.

Store changes from a Interface to Class.
Store methods like getTraits GetSchema get outsourced to Handlers.
There is will be logic for handling operations or default operations for handling unknown operations.
In simplest form the default handler will throw an UnhandledOperation Exception.

ProxyStore becomes a configured implementation of Store with core behaviour of "forward everything to remote store" becomes a configured default handler.

FederatedStore default behaviour finds the first store to support the operation. Federated Operations require some form of merging responses and will require a handler to do so.

This will be done as part of #2031 and merged into develop-2 first.

Remove OperationChain from Store
body:
At the moment everything is wrapped in OperationChains to be run by the Store/Graph.  This is then wrapped in a GraphRequest and run.

If you only have one Operation to run, this means it will be wrapped, then passed, then the Operation is extracted back out of the Chain and run.  This also won't work if you want to use no OperationChainHandler/might not work correctly with a custom one.

To fix this all references within Store/Graph (and therefore the GraphRequest) should be changed to Operation instead of OperationChain.

This will most likely be done as a subtask of #2031.

title: Allow ExecuteJob to be done as an Operation
body: As a Job class is introduced into Gaffer as part of #1920, any Operation that should be run as a Job (scheduled or otherwise) should be wrapped within a Job class.  This means a Job should be able to be passed through the Execute Operation and run within an ExecuteJob operation.  This will allow different implementations on a Store basis and remove the need for the JobTracker within a default Store.

title: Investigate multiple Store Properties classes

These are getting confusing and make things like a Federated/Proxy store difficult to use.  They only really contain some specifics for the Stores and maybe some helper getter/setters for properties.

This should be investigated and made so there is just a single StoreProperties class that is used for all.  This may involve using a single util class for the helper getter/setters.

Based on implementation this could be a breaking change, so V2 milestone has been set.

Make client classes accessible to proxy/federated stores
body: When deploying proxy or federated stores, you need to include the Operations, Functions and Data classes of the remote stores to enable the operations to be processed. If stores made a client jar available to clients, this mechanism could be automated, with stores able to dynamically update themselves as remote dependencies change or new stores are added.

title: Execute NamedOperations in the same way as other Operations
body:
Currently, NamedOperations allow the execution of a pre-configured Operation or OperationChain. NamedOperations are called in a different way to natively supported Operations:

- An Operation is executed by supplying an instance of the specific Operation class that the user wishes to execute.
- A NamedOperation is executed by supplying an instance of NamedOperation containing the name of the operation the user wishes to execute.

This means that the user needs to know whether the operation they wish to run is a NamedOperation or a natively supported Operation. It would be better if both types of operation were executed in the same way so that the user does not need to distinguish between the 2.

title: Investigate Graph and Store
body:
Currently there are two ways to execute, graph.execute and store.execute.  These two methods do slightly different things.  

For example if you execute on the Graph there are methods such as updateOperationChainView which are run, however if store.execute is called these methods are not and cannot be run (because they rely on things like the GraphConfig).

This issue becomes a problem if you run secondary Operations from within Handlers, where there is only access to the Store.

This issue should be addressed and resolved, with one point of entry and one way of execution.

title: gh-1945 - fix to ApplicationConfig empty path and test added
Publish and Subscribe Operations
body:
With the proxy store and federated store I can run a query on one Gaffer graph and write the results into another. 

When i do this, I move all of the data via the "client" that interacts with the federated store - which can be slow if the "client" is single threaded or a network bottleneck.

Many Gaffer queries read or write to an Iterable of objects. If i could post the objects on this iterable to a Kafka queue for example and then read it off again I could execute operation chains efficiently across  different graphs in different locations.

To do this, we need a Publish operation that takes the result of a Gaffer operation and posts it to an endpoint, and a Subscribe operation that reads from an endpoint into a Gaffer operation.

For example, I can run GetAllElements on Graph_1, Publish the resulting iterable to a Kafka Queue "endpoint", then run Subscribe on the endpoint and submit the resulting iterable of Elements to an AddElements on Graph_2. This could be executed as a single op-chain.

title: ImportRDDOfElements fails with "failed to create file" error on Parquet store
body:
When `ImportRDDOfElements` is called on the Parquet store it can fail with a "failed to create file" error in the `input.foreachPartition` stage. This is because speculative execution is causing multiple attempts for the same partition to all attempt to create the same file.

There are a few options for fixing this:

- Write each file with a filename that includes the attempt id. Once the task has finished, move it to it's final destination.
- Reuse some of the classes related to `FileCommitProtocol` from Spark.
- Write all the elements into one Dataframe (with merged schema) and then write out bucketed by group.

title: Change partitioning approach in ParquetStore
body:
The elements in the ParquetStore should be partitioned so that all instances of the same edge are in the same partition, but edges for the same vertex can be in different partitions. This will allow it to deal with high degree vertices.

This change will mean that data ingested with previous versions of the ParquetStore will not be readable.

title: gh-1859 - Implement a Reduce operation.
body:
A simple implementation of a `Reduce` operation which should be compatible with the existing Koryphe `BinaryOperator` classes.

There's an issue with generic invariance on the Java 8 implementation of the `Stream#reduce(BinaryOperator<T> binaryOperator)` method.

A workaround is to "coerce" the types of objects in the stream into the target type by using the three argument `reduce(U identity, BiFunction<U,? super T,U> accumulator, BinaryOperator<U> combiner)` method.

I can provide more examples of the `Reduce` operation as an integration test if that would be helpful.

The `@Since` annotations will also need to be updated, depending on your release schedule.

The output of the ToCsv is incorrect if a field is null.
Entity(vertex=1) and Edge(source=2, dest=3, count=1) when applied to ToCsv(vertex, source, count) should give:
```
1,,
,2,1
```

But the current output is:
```

```

title: Create a simplified Java API
body:
When writing complex operation chains in Java the code gets quite verbose and the large number of generic types can cause problems matching up operation input/output types.

For new users it would be helpful to have a library of all operations so users could make use of auto complete in their IDE.

Related to #1710.

We should also add some extra builder methods to help with common tasks such as performing a GetAdjacentIds operation down one or more edges.

For example:

```java
final OperationChain<Iterable<String>> opChain = input("South West")
        .then(hop("RegionContainsLocation"))
        .then(hop("LocationContainsRoad"))
        .then(deduplicate())
        .then(hop("RoadHasJunction"))
        .then(getEntities("JunctionUse")
                .view(createView()
                        .filter("startDate", inDateRange().start("2000/01/01").end("2001/01/01"))
                        .summarise()
                        .filter("countByVehicleType", predicateMap().key("BUS").predicate(isMoreThan().value(1000L)))
                        .transform("countByVehicleType", freqMapExtractor().key("BUS"), "busCount")))
        .then(sort()
                .groups("JunctionUse")
                .property("busCount")
                .reverse()
                .limit(2)
                .deduplicate())
        .then(toCsv()
                .vertex("Junction")
                .property("busCount", "Bus Count"));
```

title: Allow variables to be used in Operation Chains
Create SetVariable, GetVariable and GetVariables Operations
body:
These operations would behave similarly to how you might use ExportToSet("A") and GetSetExport("A").

The operations should use a new 'variables' Map field within the Context object.

The SetVariable operation should take an input and a variable name and set the input on the variables map in the Context. It should not have an output.

The GetVariable operation should take a variable name and fetch it from the variables map in the Context. It should not take an input.

The GetVariables operation should allow a user to provide a list of variable names and a map of variable name to value is returned.

The failure to re-create an element inside the accumulo store is a breaking event, if it happens within an iterator it will cause the iterator to constantly error an re-try,

title: Create Join Operation
body:
Being able to join iterables together as part of an OperationChain would enable interesting use cases, such as forming connections between entities that both have an edge to a common vertex. A Join operation, with the standard operation input as the left hand side, and a nested Operation that resolves the right (this could be another GetElements operation or a GetExport, for example) would allow us to achieve this.
The Operation would need to know how to join the left and right, so we could specify a 'leftKey' and 'rightKey' Function that would enable us to group the 2 sides, along with a 2 input 'joinFunction' that will merge the inputs from the left and right sides.

title: Create SingletonList Operation
body: Sometimes it is useful to be able to chain operations that produce a single output with operations that expect an iterable input (Selecting the first element from an ordered list, and then using it to seed a subsequent query, for example). Creating a 'SingletonList' operation that wraps an input object in a list and presents it to the next operation would enable this.

title: Create new ForEach Operation
body:
It would be useful if there was an operation that could execute a nested operation for each item in an iterable input, this would enable us to execute complex chains such as enrichment of inputs based on the result of a different query.

So given input [1, 2, 3, 4, 5], ForEach(GetElements) would query a graph for seed [1], then [2], etc. until all inputs have been processed.

Most operations accept iterable inputs, so this would likely be dependent on the creation of an operation that can wrap an object in a singleton list. See #1846 .

title: Updating koryphe version 1.5.0-RC2
Unable to federate over 2 graphs that have different visibility properties
body:
If you create 2 graphs in the FederatedStore with different visibility property names ("visibility1" and "visibility2") then you cannot run a single operation over both graphs at the same time.

This is because, in order to federated over the 2 graphs at the same time, we need to be able to merge the schemas together. But, because the visibilityProperty value is different the schemas cannot be merged together.

A workaround is to run 2 separate queries and merge the results, GetElements on graph1 and then GetElements on graph2. This way the queries are done separately and the schemas don't need to be merged together. It isn't very pretty but currently it is the only way of doing it. For example:

```
GetElements(options:{graphId: graph1})
ExportToSet
GetElements(options:{graphId: graph2})
ExportToSet
DiscardOutput
GetSetExport
```

title: Create a utility to create a Schema based on some configuration
body:
It is common for Gaffer Schemas to have quite a bit of boiler plate code, such as:
- commonly used types
  - count
  - time/date
  - visibility
- cardinality Entities on all vertices

It would be nice to be able to provide something like a CSV with headers and auto generate a schema based on the header names. Users would also have to tell Gaffer which columns in the CSV represented source/dest/vertex/group.

Linked to #1867 

This should be done after #1657 and before #1536.

title: Updated Koryphe version to 1.5.0-RC1

Gh 1818 jobid header
Add the ability to give users read only access to federated graphs
body:
Currently when you add a graph to the federated store you can specify graphAuths. These auths give users full read/write access to the graph. We should add graphWriteAuths to allow the graph to be locked down.

For backwards compatibility, we will need the logic to behave the same as it currently does when graphWriteAuths is set to null.

I.e if graphWriteAuths is null, the all users with access to graphAuths will be given read/write access. If graphWriteAuths is an empty, then users with access to graphAuths are only given read access. If graphWriteAuths contains auths then only users with those auths can write to the graph.

Users without write access should not be allowed to delete the Graph using RemoveGraph operation. They should also not be allow to run specific operations on the graph, such as AddElements. This list of 'add' operations should be configurable by a sys admin via the federated store properties.

title: Serialisation doesn't work if Jackson version 2.9 is on the class path

The equals methods in TypeSubTypeValue and TypeValue classes should treat empty and null strings the same
body:
The serialisers for TypeSubTypeValue and TypeValue treat empty strings as null values. This isn't ideal, but we are stuck with this for now as we don't want to introduce a breaking change.

This means if you query for TypeSubTypeValue("", "", X), then you will get back TypeSubTypeValue(null, null, X). In order to make this easier to process we should update the equals and hash code methods so they treat empty strings as nulls.

Due to this current bug, using TypeSubTypeValue("", "", X) as a seed in a GetWalks operation will fail.

When you execute an operation on a Graph, the Graph now creates a new jobId.

There is also currently no easy way of getting a jobId back when you execute an operation on the Graph.

E.g /graph/operations/GetElements. should return a field: 

```json
{
    "name": "includeIncomingOutGoing",
    "className": "java.lang.String",
    "options": ["EITHER", "INCOMING", "OUTGOING"],
    "required": false
}
```

title: gh-1812 - generic array fields are now handled
/graph/operations/{className} end point doesn't handle array fields properly
body:
For example:
http://localhost:8080/rest/v2/graph/operations/GetElementsInRanges

Returns a field like:
```json
{
      "name": "input",
      "className": "I_ITEM[]",
      "required": false
}
```

The className value should be uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.data.element.Element[].

This will cause issues in the Gaffer UI when https://github.com/gchq/gaffer-tools/issues/512 is implemented.

title: Allow the set permissions step to be skipped in the Accumulo import R files job
body:
When importing data from HDFS into Accumulo, part of the process sets the permissions on the generated R files. This step isn't always required and we should allow users to disable it if they don't need it.

HDFS permissions can be set globally using:

spark.hadoop.fs.permissions.unmask-mode

and/or

fs.permissions.unmast-mode

Specifically we need to conditionally run IngestUtils.setDirectoryPermsForAccumulo in the ImportElementsToAccumuloTool class.

We could implement this by adding a Gaffer operation option "accumulostore.operation.hdfs.skip_permissions" so advanced users could set this to "true",  which would then skip calling IngestUtils.setDirectoryPermsForAccumulo.

```
x.x.causedBy.0 | org.sonatype.nexus.proxy.walker.WalkerException: Aborted walking on repository ID='ukgovgchq-1158' from path='/'.
```

title: Updating koryphe version 1.4.0
Signature of methods in SchemaElementDefinition
body:
In `SchemaElementDefinition` the signature of the method `getGroupBy` is to return `Set<String>`. The actual object that is returned is of type `LinkedHashSet`. Many callers of this method assume that the results are in a consistent order, e.g. when properties are serialised they need to always be serialised in the same order. As the result is a `LinkedHashSet`, the results are in a consistent order. But as the signature doesn't guarantee that, in theory the implementation of `SchemaElementDefinition` could change (to return a `HashSet` for example) and client code would break as the order would not be consistent.

There are similar issues with `getIdentifierMap` and `getProperties`.

If we think that the only callers of these methods are internal to Gaffer then we can just update the signature. If not, then we can deprecate these methods and replace them with ones that guarantee a consistent order and update all the callers of the methods in Gaffer to use the new ones.

title: Possible bug in AccumuloKeyRangePartitioner
body:
The `getSplits` method in `AccumuloKeyRangePartitioner` gets the splits from Accumulo and then stores them in an array of Strings. The line

    splits.parallelStream().map(Text::toString).collect(Collectors.toList()).toArray(arr)

uses `parallelStream` which means that possibly the results won't be in the same order as the input. It's essential that they are sorted as `Arrays.binarySearch` is called on the result which requires that the array is sorted.

Related to this, the line

    final Collection<Text> splits = connector.tableOperations().listSplits(table);

shows that the result of `listSplits` is a `Collection`. In practice this is probably always returned sorted, but the signature (and Javadoc) does not guarantee that. It may be safer to explicitly sort the `splits`.

title: Gh 1798 deprecate seed matching
Create ability to include all groups for Entities/Edges in a View
Gh 1780 add version prop to rest service
Deprecate the seedMatching option on Operations
body:
The seed matching option allows users to define whether they want Edges/Entities that are 'equal to' or 'related to' their seeds. 

For Entity Seeds, the matching types determines whether to return just the Entities at the given vertices or also return any Edges that are linked to a vertex.

For Edge Seeds, the matching types determines whether to return just the Edges that have the same src/dest/direction as the Edge seed or also return the Entities either end of the edge seeds.

So effectively the matching type allows you to limit whether Entities and/or Edges are returned. This can and probably should just be done using the View. We should deprecate this flag and remove it in version 2.0 as it will simplify for user queries and also the logic for any new store implementations.

title: gh-1796 - enabled FAIL_ON_UNKNOWN_PROPERTIES in Jackson

This will mean, if any new fields are added to classes in Gaffer, it won't cause failures for older versions of Gaffer. We should give users the option to disable this in their Store Properties file.

title: Directed field should be an enum
body:
The directed field for an edge group in the schema is currently specified using a type, e.g. type="aBoolean", class="Boolean", validation="isTrue". There are a couple of problems with this: it's unnecessarily complicated; if no validation is specified it doesn't let us determine if the edges in that group are always directed, always undirected, or both.

We could deprecate specifying this by a type, and instead use an enum: all edges in this group are directed, all edges in this group are undirected, edges in this group may be directed or undirected.

title: When adding an invalid Graph to the FederatedStore the graph may still be created in Accumulo
body:
When an invalid Graph is added to the FederatedStore the graph is first initialised, then validated. This means that if the Graph is backed by Accumulo/HBase the graph may still be created in Accumulo, even though an exception is later thrown and the user is given an error message.

This means the graph is added to Accumulo, but not the FederatedStore. In the future a different graph could be added with a different schema, but with the same graphId. The federated store will assume this is ok and Accumulo will just assume the schemas match and will attempt to use the wrong schema. This will later cause issues in serialisation/aggregation within Accumulo.

title: NPE in Parquet store when adding element with group that is not in the schema
body:
The following code produces a NPE:

    Schema s1 = new Schema.Builder()
                .type("string", String.class)
                .type("long", Long.class)
                .edge("X", new SchemaEdgeDefinition.Builder().source("string").destination("string").property("long", "long").aggregate(false).build())
                .build();
    Graph g = new Graph.Builder()
                .addSchema(s1)
                .storeProperties(TestUtils.getParquetStoreProperties(testFolder))
                .config(new GraphConfig.Builder().graphId("g").build())
                .build();

    User user = new User();
    Edge undirectedEdge = new Edge.Builder()
                .group("Y")
                .source("A")
                .dest("B")
                .directed(false)
                .property("long", 2L)
                .build();
    g.execute(
                new AddElements.Builder()
                        .input(undirectedEdge)
                        .build(),
                user
        );

Direct download link to the jar: [here](https://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=io/github/lukehutch/fast-classpath-scanner/2.10.0/fast-classpath-scanner-2.10.0.jar).

title: Allow users to configure which walks are returned in a GetWalks operation
body:
Currently GetWalks only returns full walks. In some cases users may also want to return partial walks.
For example if you do 4 hops you may want to return an walks that are length 3 or length 4.

In this case:
1 - 2 - 3 - 4
1 - 5 - 6
We should not return the walk 1 - 2 - 3 as we will return the length 4 walk instead.

To achieve this we should add a new field to the GetWalks operation. This field should allow users to configure the types of Walks that are returned. Perhaps this field could be an object that contains a transform Operation and a Predicate, similar to the Conditional object used in If and While. We would need to pass test Walk objects to the transform/predicate so that we can test whether or not we return it. 

By default we should continue to only return full walks.

Add a pre-aggregation transform stage
body:
It appears that transforms are applied post-aggregation. If a pre-aggregation transform stage was added, transient properties generated in the pre-aggregation transform could have be aggregated.

Current?:
pre-filter
aggregate
transform
post-filter

If the suggestion is adopted:
pre-transform*
pre-filter
pre-transform*
aggregate
transform
post-filter

*not sure which would be the better place to insert.

This concept could be taken a step further to allow a pre and post aggregation generic filter/transform chain. Or even allow specific chains of filter, transform and aggregation sequences to be specified.

gh-1737 - constant timestamp for aggregated groups
CommonTimeUtil.timeToBucket() switch statement does not have all enums
AddElementsFromHdfs Reducer doesn't aggregate elements in Accumulo
body:
This bug was introduced in 1.4.0.

Linked to #1581.

The reducer is configured to use the Accumulo key, which includes the timestamp. As the timestamp is set to a random number, no elements will have the same key and therefore no aggregation will occur. This will put a lot of load on Accumulo to aggregate the elements and causes a lot of unnecessary data to be passed around.

title: gh-1737 - accumulo timestamp is now set to a random number
Accumulo store may skip over similar non-aggregated elements
body: There is a 'limitation' in Accumulo where you can't have 'many' rows with the same Key. When you scan over the rows, the scanner reads the data in batches. After the first batch Accumulo tries to work out where to restart the scan and will skip over rows that have a key equal to one already read. To fix this we will set the timestamp to a random number for non aggregated groups. Aggregated elements work already as the elements with the same key are aggregated together, so there are never duplicate rows with the same key.

title: Gh 1713 fed store enable/disable graphs by default
Allow Federated Graphs to be disabled/enabled
body:
Currently in the FederatedStore, if you execute a GetElements operation you can specify which graphs to execute the operation on using the graphId operation option. But if that option is not specified it will delegate that query to all Graphs you have access to. If that is a large number of graphs that could result in a large number of queries.

To fix this, we could 'enable' all graphs by default and also allow users to add graphs that are 'disabled' by default. Being 'disabled' by default would require that the user specifies the graphId for each graph they want to access. This could be done via new field 'disabledByDefault' - which defaults to false.

title: Gh 1696 add graph with hooks
Add a GraphHook to update Operation Views depending on the User auths
body:
UpdateViewHook is a hook to update all operation views in a chain before it is executed. This hook can be configured to add additional view configurations such as extra filters and it can also be used to remove element groups out of a view. This hook will have no effect with operations that do not correctly implement OperationView therefore THIS HOOK SHOULD NOT BE USED TO ENFORCE ROLE BASED FILTERING OF ELEMENTS. Instead please make use of the visibility property (uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.store.schema.Schema.visibilityProperty).

All fields are Optional:

- withOpAuth = Apply this hook to Users with any of these operation authorisations
- withoutOpAuth = Apply this hook to Users without any of these operation authorisations, overrides withOpAuth
- withDataAuth = Apply this hook to Users with any of these data authorisations
- withoutDataAuth = Apply this hook to Users without any of these data authorisations, overrides withDataAuth
- whiteListElementGroups = When this hook is applied, only allow View Element Groups from this list, overrides viewToMerge
- blackListElementGroups = When this hook is applied, remove all View Element Groups from this list, overrides whiteListElementGroups and viewToMerge
- viewToMerge = the view to be merged into the current view.

If the user matches the opAuth or dataAuth criteria the following is applied:

- First the viewToMerge is merged into the user provided operation view.
- Then the white list of element groups is applied.
- Then the black list of element groups is applied.

title: gh-1690 - refactored DefaultScoreResolver, added tests
body:
DefaultScoreResolver now resolves the score for nested operations recursively.

title: Scoring a complex nested operations may return the wrong score
body:
Currently the DefaultScoreResolver does not handle nested operations, ie implementations of the Operations interface. 

This is okay in most cases as the ScoreOperationChainHandler does recursively score nested operations. But if custom ScoreResolvers are included that delegate a nested operation to the DefaultScoreResolver, then these nested operations will not be scored individually.

Therefore the logic in ScoreOperationChainHandler should be moved to DefaultScoreResolver to fully handle nested operations. We also need to be careful to prevent infinite recursion.

title: Updated Koryphe version to 1.3.0-RC1
Update to Koryphe 1.3.0-RC1
Should we attempt to make Gaffer a more general purpose framework?
body:
Gaffer offers a lot more than just a graph database, you get quite a lot of functionality out of the box and on the other hand a lot of normal graph operations are not included (shortest path, page rank, etc.). It is likely that someone may want to use some of Gaffer's functionality without wanted to store their data in a graph format. Currently you can actually use Gaffer without any Edges, i.e just rows in a table, indexed by a single id (the vertex), but this isn’t very obvious.

Here are some of Gaffer's features that could be reused independent of it being a graph database:
- NamedOperations (and NamedViews)
- Job Tracker (basic implementation)
- Operations and handlers
- Pluggable components
- Aggregation/summarisation
- Age off/continuous validation
- Graph hooks
- REST API
- UI
- Python shell

When you start using Gaffer a lot of the above features are optional and can be independently enabled/disabled, so I don’t think we necessarily need to split these components up any further. 

If someone wants to use Gaffer purely for the operation/handler api then we/they could implement a new Store that does not implement Get/Add and just register any custom operations and handlers - perhaps we should actually create a store for this purpose now?

I guess what we could do is remove/decouple any references to ‘graph' in our core libraries. This would involve things like:
- Rename Graph to GafferConnector
- Rename GraphHooks to Hooks
- Rename GraphLibrary to GafferLibrary
- In the UI we could easily hide the Graph view if there are no Edges in the schema. Leaving just the query builder and table view.
- Regarding the Schema, we have a couple of options (similarly with Views)
  - Just leave it as it is, but highlight that Edges aren’t required (likewise Entities aren’t required). 
  - Remove Edges from the Schema and create a GraphSchema that extends Schema and adds Edges.
  - Try to make the Element class more generic so it has a list of IDs. Entities would then just have a single vertex ID and Edges would have source, destination and directed IDs.

title: Add Since annotation to Predicate/Function/BinaryOperator implementations

If the version dates back prior to version 1.0, then we should just annotate it with version 1.0.

Once this has been completed we need to update the Gaffer Doc to include this information.

Any implementations of ScoreResolver which are native to Gaffer are now added to the list of available ScoreResolvers by default. 

This can easily be expanded as and when any new implementations are added, but still allows for externally configurable resolvers to be added via a json config file.

title: Register existing ScoreResolvers by default
body:
As new operations are being added which require implementations of ScoreResolver, the system should be redesigned to make it easier to configure.

Existing ScoreResolvers should be registered by default, and the ScoreOperationChainHandler should automatically find the necessary resolver from this registration (probably just a Map of ScoreResolver to class).

In future, if a new ScoreResolver is added to Gaffer, this should also be added to the default ScoreResolvers, while still allowing external Resolvers to be configured via a json file.

title: gh-1670 - added caching iterable
Optimise the If operation to avoid scanning accumulo twice
body:
The result of a queries on accumulo (e.g GetAdjacentIds) is a lazy iterable that will scan accumulo every time the result is iterated over. In the new If operation, the result is used in a predicate to determine what operation to do next. This would mean the result is iterated over once in the predicate and a second time in the following operation. We should avoid this by caching the first few items in the iterable.

We could create a reusable CachedIterable, that caches the results as you iterate over them. The cache should have a maximum size, if there are too many results then the results should just be reloaded from Accumulo each time.

title: A new user context is required for every Graph execution
body:
The Graph class has various methods for executing operations. Some of those methods take a User Context object. A new context object must be used every time an operation is executed on a Graph, which includes a new job id. This is not currently enforced. Users can currently reuse the same context for multiple operations. This will cause problems with clashing job IDs and some of the Context fields will be overridden.

This fix, will clone the context object that is passed to the Graph.execute method. If you hold onto your original Context instance, you need to be aware that, as it is now a different instance, any changes that are made by the Graph to the Context will not be applied to your Context instance.

title: Gh 1649 if operation
body:
If operation added.
Accepts either a boolean or a "Conditional" POJO (see below), and will then execute one of two provided "Operation"s, namely "then", and "otherwise".

The "Conditional" POJO wraps both a Predicate and an Operation, which allows a user to non-destructively transform the input before it is tested by the predicate.

For example, given an Edge as an input to the If operation, the "Conditional" POJO would allow a user to apply an OperationChain which, for example, could extract the "count" property from the Edge. 
The value of the "count" property could then be passed to an "IsMoreThan", and then based on this result, the Edge can still be passed to the resulting "then" or "otherwise" Operations.
