body: The word "simple" in "simple-function-library", "simple-operation-library" and "simple-serialisation-library" is unnecessary. These libraries should contain functions / operations / serialisers that are likely to be useful to Gaffer users. Over time they may contain more complex functionality than now, and so "simple" will be misleading. Propose simply removing the word "simple" from each of these.

Use of deprecated goal in maven assembly plugin
body: The goal "assembly" in the maven assembly plugin is deprecated and can lead to non-standard builds and potential forking issues with dependencies during the build. The goal "single" should be used.

title: ArrayList store should return results lazily
body: The ArrayList store produces a List of results when queried. Stores should return their results lazily, i.e. only extract data from the underlying storage layer as the user consumes it by reading through the iterable of results. This avoids unnecessary work if the user decides to not read through all the results. It also avoids memory pressure in the store - materialising all the edges for a high-degree node into a set could use a lot of memory.

AddElementsFromHdfs - check folders first
body:
When running the AddElementsFromHdfs Operation for Bulk Import, if the failure path does not already exist then the operation does not tell you until after the initial Map/Reduce job has run. It would be useful to do all directory checks upfront and present error to the user accordingly before running the actual operation rather than having to wait potentially hours to find that the second part of the operation failed.

Similarly, the output path is not allowed to exist before the job is run, yet the failure path has to exist. Seems a bit inconsistent

title: Error message in view and schema function validation is not clear
body:
The schema and view function validation creates an incorrect error message when a function selection type cannot be found in the view/schema. The log statement is in classes SchemaElementDefinitionValidator and ViewValidator.

For example, the error message currently says:

```
Function gaffer.function.simple.filter.IsMoreThan is not compatible with selection types. Function input type java.lang.Comparable is not assignable from selection type with a null class
```

It would be much clearer if it just said one of the following.
if type definition is null:

```
No type definition defined for "property1". Please ensure it is defined in the schema.
```

if type definition has no class type:

```
No class type found for type definition "type1" used by property "property1". Please ensure it is defined in the schema.
```

title: Operation chain builder generics stops some valid operation chains
body:
It should be possible to chain a getAdjacentEntitySeeds operation with a getRelatedEdges, i.e.:

``` java
new OperationChain.Builder()
    .first(new GetAdjacentEntitySeeds.Builder()
            .addSeed(new EntitySeed("1"))
            .build())
    .then(new GetRelatedEdges())
    .build();
```

The operation chain requires the output from op 1 to be compatible with the input to op2. In this example the output from op1 is Iterable[EntitySeed] and the input from op2 is Iterable[ElementSeed]. As EntitySeed is an extension of ElementSeed this should be allowed.

We could open up the operation chain so it doesn't check the generic types - but this could lead to operation chains being invalid. Alternatively we could change the input type of GetRelatedEdges to [? extends ElementSeed]. This second option is preferable, but knock on implications need to be checked and we should should also update other operations such as GetRelatedEntities to [? extends ElementSeed] too.
### Current workaround

Cast the GetRelatedEdges into GetEdges and ignore the unchecked assignment warning.

``` java
new OperationChain.Builder()
    .first(new GetAdjacentEntitySeeds.Builder()
            .addSeed(new EntitySeed("1"))
            .build())
    .then((GetEdges) new GetRelatedEdges())
    .build();
```

Swagger Servlet does not get loaded automatically in Tomcat
body:
When creating an example REST project containing the Gaffer rest-api module as a dependency and deploying to Tomcat 9, the SwaggerJaxrsConfig servlet does not get loaded on startup and thus Swagger  does not work correctly.

This looks to be due to the way the Servlet is defined in the code:
`@WebServlet(name = "SwaggerJaxrsConfig", loadOnStartup = 2)`
According to the Servet 3.x spec at least one URL pattern MUST be declared in either the value or urlPattern attribute of the annotation

One solution would be the following:
`@WebServlet(name = "SwaggerJaxrsConfig", urlPatterns = {"/SwaggerJaxrsConfig"}, loadOnStartup = 2)`

title: Equals method on Element
body:
The equals method on Element ignores the Properties. There is a deepEquals method to perform an equals if it is desired that the Properties are included in the test.

What should the default be? The Properties are an integral part of the Element (cf Gaffer1 where the Properties were separate) so suggest the default is that the Properties should be included in the equals.

We want to support multigraphs, where there can be multiple edges between nodes (even of the same element type), so it feels more consistent with that aim to have Properties included in the equals.

If the consensus is to leave it as it is, can we record the justification here?

title: Accumulo store - should initialisation create table?
body:
In the LoadAndQuery1 example, if a query is made before elements have been added then an error is thrown as the table hasn't been created. It should be possible to query a graph which no data has been put into.

It should also be possible to create a graph, and then insert data from multiple independent processes. In this case it is important that the table exists before the data insertion starts.

Suggest that the initialise method on AccumuloStore creates the table.

For this simple proxy store there will be no authentication. In the future  other proxy stores may be required that use different authentication mechanisms.

title: Create an operation cache
body:
This might involve 2 operations:
- UpdateCache - stores the input in the cache (with a provided string key) and returns the input
- FetchCache - returns the entire cache
- FetchCachedResults - returns results from the cache with the provided key

The cache should work for elements or just objects and allow users to cache steps of an operation chain separately - this could be achieved by passing in a key as part of the UpdateCache operation.

For small amounts of data a `HashMap<String, Iterable<Object>>` would work for for the cache. We could consider added options to UpdateCache to specify the type of cache you wish to use - for example the cache could be a new Gaffer graph.

For example:
- Build up a graph of all vertices traversed

``` java
final Iterable<?> cachedResults = graph.execute(new Builder()
    .first(new GetAdjacentEntitySeeds.Builder()
            .addSeed(new EntitySeed("A"))
            .build())
    .then(new UpdateCache())
    .then(new GetAdjacentEntitySeeds())
    .then(new UpdateCache())
    .then(new FetchCachedResult())
    .build());
```
- Get related edges and entities separately

``` java
final Map<String, Iterable<?>> cachedResults = graph.execute(new Builder()
        .first(new GetAdjacentEntitySeeds.Builder()
                .addSeed(new EntitySeed("A"))
                .build())
        .then(new UpdateCache("adj-seeds"))
        .then(new GetEntitiesBySeed())
        .then(new UpdateCache("entities"))
        .then(new FetchCachedResult("adj-seeds"))
        .then(new GetRelatedEdges())
        .then(new UpdateCache("edges"))
        .then(new FetchCache())
        .build());
```

body:
Some operations added to the accumulo-store are not serialisable,
this task will ensure all Operations that have been added are properly serialisable.

title: Modify AccumuloStore to remove duplicated .iterator() call and ensure scanners are closed.
body: A duplicated .iterator() call in the accumulo retrievers within the accumulo store causes operation chaining to fail because scanners are closed prematurely because calling .iterator() a second time creates a second scanner orphaning the first with result sets in.

title: JSON Serialisation util to rationalise test code
body: Remove duplicate JSON Serialisation code in filter (and other) tests.

title: gh-99 - Added MapContains and FreqMapIsMoreThan
G46 validate views
Create a builder for Graph
body:
There are a lot of different constructors for the Graph class and it is still not flexible enough. 

We need to make it easier to construct a Graph with schemas, properties and a view coming from different combination of sources, such as a stream, a path or a java object. 

This could be achieved by creating a Graph Builder.

title: Create Map and FreqMap filters
body:
It would be useful to be able to filter elements with a Map as a property.

2 filters are required:
- MapContains - filter based on a map containing a provided key
- FreqMapIsMoreThan - filter based on a map containing a key with a frequency greater than a provided threshold

title: Allow accumulo bulk import to be run in 2 steps
body:
The bulk import from HDFS for accumulo runs as 2 jobs: fetch from HDFS and import into accumulo.
If the second job fails it would be useful to be able to rerun the operation but skip the first step.

title: G89 nested functions
gh-91 - added null check to aggregator selections
gh-92 - aggregate functions now initialise to null
G19 modular schemas
Improve multi-input function interfaces
Frequency map aggregator should return null if input is null
body: In the _state method if frequencyMap is null, then it should return null. Otherwise null values are magically converted into new frequency maps.

title: Aggregation should skip properties that don't exist
body: It should also skip properties that are null - i.e. null values should be treated as though the property does not exist.

title: Remove use of ElementComponentKeys from schemas and views
body:
Currently when adding the selection types for functions in a schema or view users have to do something like: 

``` json
"selection": [
  {
    "key": "userId",
    "isId": "false"
  }
]
```

It would be neater if the selection types were just strings rather than having to wrap it in an ElementComponentType object, so it would look like:

``` json
"selection": [ "userId" ]
```

To do this we will need to reserve the names SOURCE, DESTINATION, DIRECTED, VERTEX and prevent these being used as property names.

title: Remove unnecessary nesting from functions in schemas and views
Add description field to element groups in the schema
body: This will allow users to give a brief overview of the element group.

title: Release 0.3.2
Enable Graphs to be constructed from URLs
body: It would be useful to be able to create a Graph by providing URLs for the schemas, properties and view.

title: gh-53 - removed not flag and added Not filter function
Update to 0.3.3-SNAPSHOT
gh-78 - ensures streams are closed
G 81 cleanup error handling in accumulostore
Cleanup Error Handling in the Accumulostore
body: Some exceptions are thrown caught then re-thrown without doing any specific handling, just returning an error to the caller. Tidy this up to just throw rather than needlessly catch.

title: G17 accumulo validator filter
G78 load resources
Fails to load resources packaged in jars such as in the example
body:
It would be better to load the resources (such as dataSchema.json) as resource streams so that assembled jars (such as example simple query) can be run from the command line.

As part of the fix for this issue we also ensure all streams are closed.

title: Add Accumulostore SplitTable Operation.
body:
The accumulostore should have an operation to add split points to a table, 
These split points should be able to be generated by providing a directory of sample data, which will be used to create the splits.

In use this should be used as part of an operation chain when loading in data particularly for the first time, 
First split the table according to the data,
Then run the bulk import using then enable the accumulo partitioner option to use those new splits.

title: Add query time aggregator to the View
body:
Currently query time aggregation just uses the aggregation specified in the schema. It would be useful to be able to provide a different set of aggregation functions.

This issue should add a aggregator section to the View.

The HBase and Accumulo stores would need to be updated to use the new aggregator functions provided in the View.

As part of this ticket, the integration tests should be updated to include tests for query time aggregation

title: Move the aggregator block from Data Schema to Store Schema
body: Aggregation may not be supported by all stores and may be specific to the store implementation. Following on from gh-75, it makes more sense to the store aggregation functions to the store schema.

title: Rename Data Schema to Graph Schema
body:
This will help to make the distinction between the Graph Schema and the Store Schema. 
The Graph and REST API should then provide a method to return the GraphStore Schema - the combined schema containing the merged information from both the Graph and Store Schema.

title: Investigate option in DataSchema for additional input validation
body: We may need to add an additional section to the data schema for extra input validation. This would allow additional validation (could be computationally expensive) to be carried out when elements are added. This validation would not be done as part of the continuous validation added in issue gh-17.

title: G43 auth requirement
G17 accumulo validator filter
gh - 68 Don't override user provided splits
body:
Renaming constants files to package specific names to avoid import
conflict
Adding ability to use custom partitioner to addElementsFromhdfs
operation

title: Custom Splits File path over-ridden in accumuloStore addElementsFromHdfs operation
body: Currently you must set a splits file path on the addElementsFromHdfs operation, but it will be over-ridden with the store's default.

title: G58 fix travis 2
body: Another attempt to fix travis. I have set the fork count to 0 and disabled findbugs to reduce memory consumption. This currently seems to work.

title: gh-49 - Added maven scm publish plugin for javadoc
gh-64 - Changed reflections version to 0.9.9-RC1
Reflections library version incompatible with Swagger version
body: Change org.reflections version to 0.9.9-RC1

title: gh-62 Minor fixes for release
0.31 RC1 BugFix
body:
Small Bug fixes for RC1 branch
Null Check for empty group in AbstractCoreKeyAccumuloElementConverter,
Remove maintenance jar building as part of the accumulo-store, it must be packages up elsewhere with the functions/serialisers
Adding null check for accumulo-store bulk import partitioner option.

title: G58 fix travis
G44 func library interfaces
G50 empty aggregator
Travis CI fails to build the code
body: There seems to be an issue with travis running the build. It could be running out of memory or threads.

title: Rest Api - Investigate limiting results of an operation chain
body:
Should an N limit apply to only the first step of an operation chain?
e.g generate first N elements. Then add all these N elements.

Or should it apply to every step in an operation chain?
e.g Return the first N elements matching the given seeds then pass these N elements as the seeds of a second get Operations and limit the results of that operation to N.

Or should it apply to only the last step in an operation chain?
e.g Return all elements matching the given seeds then pass these elements as the seeds of a second get operation and return only N results of that operation.

Also investigate what to do when the result on an operation chain is void?

body: Before using a View in an operation it would be useful to validate similar to how we validate data schemas to avoid class cast exceptions.

title: Add custom annotations to auto-generate Element Generators
body: Create some custom annotations that can be used to annotate domain objects that will auto generate an ElementGenerator implementation.

title: Improve Function library interfaces
Remove the Accumulo authorisation requirement
body:
Currently all operations executed on an Accumulo store require an "authorisation" option to be set. This requirement should be removed as not all graphs will use Accumulo's visibility column and therefore operations should not be forced to have an authorisation option set.

See AccumuloStore.handleOperation

title: Add extra logging to the Filter processor
body:
If an element fails validation it can be very difficult to find out why. It would be very useful to add additional logging to the Filter processor, so that when an element is filtered out based on a data schema it logs the function name and the property that was invalid. 

We have 2 options:
- When elements are invalid based on a data schema we could log at 'warn' level. When elements are filtered out based on a View it is probably best not to log anything to avoid slowing the operations down - this may require an extra flag to toggle logging on and off in the processor.
- Log at 'debug' level for all filtering (data schema and view). Then users will have to set the level to 'debug' temporarily to see the extra information.

title: G39 findbugs
G28 checkstyle
Add findbugs maven plugin
Accumulo iterators next() methods need to return the next element
body:
See AbstractElementIteratorReadIntoMemory and AbstractElementIteratorFromBatches.

Currently multiple calls to next() will keep returning the same element. In order to use the iterators users must call hasNext() before calling next(). 

Also calling hasNext() multiple times before calling next() will skip elements.

body: The rest service doOperation/get calls call should have an optional parameter n, this will restrict the size of any returned iterable of results to n.

title: Refactor AddElementsFromHdfsHandler in AccumuloStore
body:
The AddElementsFromHdfsHandler should be changed to do the following:

The default behaviour should be set to being; using the options passed to the job through the operation/ including the reducer number and partitioner.

If an option is provided to the operation specifying that the user would like to use standard gaffer behaviour and the user also provides a splits file, then this file will be used as the job's reducer number (Any user provided reducer numbers will be over-ridden by the number of splits +1)  and the AccumuloKeyRange partitioner will be used (Replacing any previously specified one).

If no splits file has been set and the user would like to use standard gaffer behaviour, then gaffer will query the accumulo table for its split points and use those for the number of reducers (+1) and will use the AccumuloKeyRange partitioner. 

General changes will include:
Making clear the purpose of the splits file property in the accumulo store over one provided in an operation with additional comments in the store properties.
Change the default number of reducers for a job up from 1 to 25 to better reflect use at scale.
Adding an option to provide a partitioner to the AddElementsFromHdfs operation builder.

title: Expand Simple Function Library to include Regex functionality
body: To expand basic functionality we should add more functions to the simple functions library to start with we should add a filter function that allows a property or vertex identifier to be validated against one or more regular expressions.

title: Modular schemas
body: It would be useful to be able to split schemas into small schema modules. For example different data types could be stored in different schemas then the data could be loaded into the same graph by merging the schemas.

title: Cannot easily create HyperLogLogPlus sketches in JSON
body:
The JSON deserialiser for the HyperLogLogPlus sketch doesn't handle null or empty objects and simply throws an IllegalArgumentException. We should update this to create an empty HyperLogLogPlus sketch to allow objects to be created in JSON.

Currently to create a HyperLogLogPlus object in JSON you have to specify the bytes. We should also update the serialisation and deserialisation methods to allow you to set all parameters in the HyperLogLogPlus object in JSON.

title: Add store validation trait
body:
A new store trait (STORE_VALIDATION) will be used to allow store implementations to continuously validate elements and remove elements that are no longer valid. This will also allow custom age off and expiration filters to be written based on FilterFunctions. For example, you could age off elements based on properties, e.g (timestamp > x) AND (count < y).

Accumulo store should support store validation by adding a new validation iterator. 
NOTE - the previous AgeOff accumulo iterator will no longer be used. To migrate to using the new store validator, store schemas will need to be updated to add an AgeOff validator function for each element group that needs to be aged off.  

Added a new AccumuloProperty "gaffer.store.accumulo.enable.validator.iterator" to disable the store validation if it is not required.

The previous VALIDATION trait has been removed as validation is handled via a validation operation automatically so it wouldn't make sense for a store not to be able to validate the elements. There is still the option to disable validation.

title: Add post-filter stage to operations
body:
Rename the current filter stage to pre-filter and create a new stage called post-filter.
This will allow users to filter based on aggregated properties and transient properties (properties created by the transform stage).

The order of operation stages would then be:
pre-filter
aggregate
transform
post-filter

We need to consider also adding a mid-filter:
pre-filter
aggregate
mid-filter
transform
post-filter
